commit_message:
Add stein gate test

This patchset adds the stein gate check and the changes necessary in
basic_deployment.py to get the auth to pass, as the app has changed
slightly since rocky.

Change-Id: I2dfde541ebcceb7b29a055fd75cd783e845839b5

commit_message:
Fix capitalization of project name in README

This change makes capitalization of "OpenStack" consistent with the
other reviewed OpenStack/Charm READMEs (e.g. charm-{ceph-osd,
keystone, neutron-api, openstack-dashboard, rabbitmq-server}).

Change-Id: I85382af9c9654d1b21e0b43ea59407c7c7a7061e

subject: Allow bulk delete of big SLO manifests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-01 20:17:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/a3a0b7ca12c510c7d21173a4b5fc3773a0f7b4c4', 'message': 'Allow bulk delete of big SLO manifests

If you set SLO's max_manifest_segments to a value larger than 10000,
then clients are able to create manifests with that many segments, but
unable to use "?multipart-manifest=delete" to delete them.

This is because the SLO middleware has its very own bulk-deleter that
it uses to handle such requests, and that bulk-deleter only allows
10000 deletions per request by default. This commit removes the
limitation so that any SLO manifest can be deleted along with its
segments.

I considered setting max-deletes-per-request to be equal to SLO's
max_manifest_segments, but that only works if max_manifest_segments
has never been decreased.

Note that this commit does not increase max_manifest_segments. Clients
cannot make SLOs any bigger than they could before. Also note that
this commit does not affect user-initiated bulk deletes, i.e. POST
requests with "?bulk-delete=true" set. Those requests are still
limited in their size, and those limits are not changed.

Change-Id: I6a35937e8418f4f2b8e29825fc9c40415e34742f
Closes-Bug: 1746685

commit_message:
Allow bulk delete of big SLO manifests

If you set SLO's max_manifest_segments to a value larger than 10000,
then clients are able to create manifests with that many segments, but
unable to use "?multipart-manifest=delete" to delete them.

This is because the SLO middleware has its very own bulk-deleter that
it uses to handle such requests, and that bulk-deleter only allows
10000 deletions per request by default. This commit removes the
limitation so that any SLO manifest can be deleted along with its
segments.

I considered setting max-deletes-per-request to be equal to SLO's
max_manifest_segments, but that only works if max_manifest_segments
has never been decreased.

Note that this commit does not increase max_manifest_segments. Clients
cannot make SLOs any bigger than they could before. Also note that
this commit does not affect user-initiated bulk deletes, i.e. POST
requests with "?bulk-delete=true" set. Those requests are still
limited in their size, and those limits are not changed.

Change-Id: I6a35937e8418f4f2b8e29825fc9c40415e34742f
Closes-Bug: 1746685
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/22/540122/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestSloBulkDeleter(unittest.TestCase): def test_uses_big_max_deletes(self): slo_mware = slo.filter_factory( {'max_manifest_segments': 123456789})('fake app') self.assertGreaterEqual( slo_mware.bulk_deleter.max_deletes_per_request, 123456789)

subject: dlo: Respond 200 on multi-range GETs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-05 19:05:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/0e8f7b04a648fe9b25d8cfe8ca59856875b86024', 'message': 'dlo: Respond 200 on multi-range GETs

subject: Initial support for tls_priorities
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-15 06:02:41.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/pacemaker_remote.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/database/redis_bundle.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/rabbitmq_bundle.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/haproxy_bundle.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/cinder/volume_bundle.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/manila/share_bundle.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/database/mysql_bundle.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/cinder/backup_bundle.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/pacemaker.pp', 'manifests/profile/pacemaker/ovn_dbs_bundle.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/dbae8506927bf77ed430db138461d846e81a2489', 'message': 'Initial support for tls_priorities

We add initial support for being able to specify tls priorities in
pacemaker. For bundles this will happen via an env variable because
pacemaker_remote is started normally as a process and there is no
sourcing of /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

The '-e' addition is a noop in case the PCMK_tls_priorities is unset
so that we do not change the signature of the resources and hence do
not needlessly restart the HA resource.

Depends-On: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86
Change-Id: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435
(cherry picked from commit f1a593b6425f1e95ef789dd8ac9e32f095e347ff)
'}]
commit_message:
Initial support for tls_priorities

We add initial support for being able to specify tls priorities in
pacemaker. For bundles this will happen via an env variable because
pacemaker_remote is started normally as a process and there is no
sourcing of /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

The '-e' addition is a noop in case the PCMK_tls_priorities is unset
so that we do not change the signature of the resources and hence do
not needlessly restart the HA resource.

Depends-On: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86
Change-Id: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435
(cherry picked from commit f1a593b6425f1e95ef789dd8ac9e32f095e347ff)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/83/676583/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*tls_priorities*] # (optional) Sets PCMK_tls_priorities in /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker when set # Defaults to hiera('tripleo::pacemaker::tls_priorities', undef) # $tls_priorities = hiera('tripleo::pacemaker::tls_priorities', undef), if $tls_priorities != undef { $tls_priorities_real = " -e PCMK_tls_priorities=${tls_priorities}" } else { $tls_priorities_real = '' } options => "--log-driver=journald -e KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY=COPY_ALWAYS${tls_priorities_real}",

commit_message:
CI documentation

- Jobs description: Help people understand what each job does in our CI.

Change-Id: Ia6267e9b4618d4039f0606270f8dcf759cd92750
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/92/673992/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _jobs-description: ================ Jobs description ================ The description of each jobs that runs in the CI when you submit a patch for `openstack/ironic-inspector` is visible in the table :ref:`table_jobs_description`. .. _table_jobs_description: .. list-table:: Table. OpenStack Ironic Inspector CI jobs description :widths: 45 55 :header-rows: 1 * - Job name - Description * - ironic-inspector-grenade-dsvm - Deploys Ironic and Ironic Inspector in a DevStack and runs upgrade for all enabled services. * - ironic-inspector-tempest - Deploys Ironic and Ironic Inspector in DevStack, configured to use a pre-build tinyipa ramdisk wholedisk image that is downloaded from a Swift temporary url, `pxe` boot and `ipmi` driver. Runs tempest tests that match the regex `InspectorBasicTest` and deploys 1 virtual baremetal. * - ironic-inspector-tempest-discovery - Deploys Ironic and Ironic Inspector in DevStack under Python3, configured to use a pre-build tinyipa ramdisk wholedisk image that is downloaded from a Swift temporary url, `pxe` boot and `ipmi` driver. Runs tempest tests that match the regex `InspectorDiscoveryTest` and deploys 1 virtual baremetal. * - ironic-inspector-tempest-python3 - Deploys Ironic and Ironic Inspector in DevStack under Python3, configured to use a pre-build tinyipa ramdisk wholedisk image that is downloaded from a Swift temporary url, `pxe` boot and `ipmi` driver. Runs tempest tests that match the regex `Inspector` and deploys 1 virtual baremetal. * - openstack-tox-functional - Run tox-based functional tests for Ironic Inspector under Python2 * - openstack-tox-functional-py36 - Run tox-based functional tests for Ironic Inspector under Python3.6 * - bifrost-integration-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial - Tests the integration between Ironic Inspector and Bifrost. * - ironic-inspector-tox-bandit - Runs bandit security tests in a tox environment to find known issues in the Ironic Inspector code.

subject: Avoid timeout from service update api unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-16 12:28:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_services.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/588c513f3d55d76a6ef6caa614c484cf3141b88d', 'message': "Avoid timeout from service update api unit tests

Since If32bca070185937ef83f689b7163d965a89ec10a some of the service
update api tests are slow because setting a compute enabled or
disabled makes an RPC call to the given compute service. These tests
does not have the proper RPC setup so that call times out. The compute
api only logs an error for the timeout so the tests wasn't failing.

This patch stubs the RPC call as that is not necessary for the
api testing and therefore speeds up the tests.

Change-Id: If0960de896a67fd6bfca230b8915a45cb7af99b7
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid timeout from service update api unit tests

Since If32bca070185937ef83f689b7163d965a89ec10a some of the service
update api tests are slow because setting a compute enabled or
disabled makes an RPC call to the given compute service. These tests
does not have the proper RPC setup so that call times out. The compute
api only logs an error for the timeout so the tests wasn't failing.

This patch stubs the RPC call as that is not necessary for the
api testing and therefore speeds up the tests.

Change-Id: If0960de896a67fd6bfca230b8915a45cb7af99b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/23/676923/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(gibi): enable / disable a compute service tries to call # the compute service via RPC to update placement. However in these # tests the compute services are faked. So stub out the RPC call to # avoid waiting for the RPC timeout. self.stub_out("nova.compute.rpcapi.ComputeAPI.set_host_enabled", lambda *args, **kwargs: None)

commit_message:
Check for deploy.deploy deploy step in heartbeat

Change-Id: Id160e37348c940055c312fbfdb05a27d13012f52
(cherry picked from commit b5e34e16731b47d1930bcdc99d184b1319493f1a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/51/676151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def in_core_deploy_step(self, task): """Check if we are in the deploy.deploy deploy step. Assumes that we are in the DEPLOYWAIT state. :param task: a TaskManager instance :returns: True if the current deploy step is deploy.deploy. """ # TODO(mgoddard): Remove this 'if' in the Train release, after the # deprecation period for supporting drivers with no deploy steps. if not task.node.driver_internal_info.get('deploy_steps'): return True step = task.node.deploy_step return (step and step['interface'] == 'deploy' and step['step'] == 'deploy') # NOTE(mgoddard): Only handle heartbeats during DEPLOYWAIT if we # are currently in the core deploy.deploy step. Other deploy steps # may cause the agent to boot, but we should not trigger deployment # at that point. elif node.provision_state == states.DEPLOYWAIT: if self.in_core_deploy_step(task): if not self.deploy_has_started(task): msg = _('Node failed to deploy.') self.continue_deploy(task) elif self.deploy_is_done(task): msg = _('Node failed to move to active state.') self.reboot_to_instance(task) else: node.touch_provisioning() else: node.touch_provisioning()
deleted_lines: elif (node.provision_state == states.DEPLOYWAIT and not self.deploy_has_started(task)): msg = _('Node failed to deploy.') self.continue_deploy(task) elif (node.provision_state == states.DEPLOYWAIT and self.deploy_is_done(task)): msg = _('Node failed to move to active state.') self.reboot_to_instance(task) elif (node.provision_state == states.DEPLOYWAIT and self.deploy_has_started(task)): node.touch_provisioning()

subject: Distribute direct charm dependencies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-15 10:56:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone-saml-mellon/commit/3a8526e337ffa513f4ef9356820c885c04f44883', 'message': 'Distribute direct charm dependencies

Do not rely on system installed Python packages but distribute the
direct charm dependencies as part of the charms wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see juju/charm-helpers#341 and

commit_message:
Distribute direct charm dependencies

Do not rely on system installed Python packages but distribute the
direct charm dependencies as part of the charms wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see juju/charm-helpers#341 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

Change-Id: I11fb4020dc358c40bf9c1870e94186ba7e97c2db

commit_message:
Fix for enable VFIO module on boot for SR-IOV deployments

In this change [1] I've loaded wrong module. It needs the
Type1 IOMMU driver for VFIO to be loaded on boot.

[1]: I3ffd1c11a1851e62992a6a63e8abb130db82856f

Change-Id: Iba7fa6c4edea4755afb91a97460ec3cc8e7ee234
Closes-Bug: 1838159
(cherry picked from commit 8e00cef6ff2047afd7512e86753ab656edbaadd1)

commit_message:
Migrate bagpipe legacy tempest jobs to zuulv3 and py3

Introduce new zuul v3 versions of the old
legacy-tempest-dsvm-networking-bagpipe and
legacy-tempest-dsvm-networking-bgpvpn-bagpipe jobs, for modernization
and compliance with the python 3 goal.

Change-Id: I7e2b8737703060f532463bae823f99f9ecadc0df

commit_message:
Don't reveal trust existence to unauthorized users

Without this patch, any user regardless of their relation to a trust can
GET /OS-TRUST/trusts/{trust_id} and find out whether a trust with that
ID exists: if the return code is a 404, it does not exist, whereas if it
is a 403, it exists. This violates security principles and can be used
as part of a privilege escalation attack. This change ensure that the
intended access control is enforced and does not disclose the
non-existence of a trust to unauthorized users.

Since we don't use microversions and don't intend to update the major
API version, this could be read as violating the API SIG's guidelines on
API changes for interoperability[1]. However, the security impact is
severe enough that this change is warranted.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-sig/guidelines/api_interoperability.html#evaluating-api-changes

Closes-bug: #1840288
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/676745

Change-Id: I669cd1675dcc3663aecf0e5882a3e53a3d77c1e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/28/676528/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # No more uses, the trust is made unavailable. Requesting a non-existent # trust will result in a 403 to prevent disclosing its existence or # non-existence. expected_status=http_client.FORBIDDEN) # Assert chained trust have been deleted. Requesting a non-existent # trust will result in a 403 to prevent disclosing its existence or # non-existence. expected_status=http_client.FORBIDDEN)
deleted_lines: # No more uses, the trust is made unavailable expected_status=http_client.NOT_FOUND) # Assert chained trust have been deleted expected_status=http_client.NOT_FOUND)

subject: Use list_trusts to check for deleted trust
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-15 18:06:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/75c99e884738118c7243d4d2ba7f49e864d34577', 'message': 'Use list_trusts to check for deleted trust

The keystone trusts API currently makes some flawed choices about access
control. First, there is a security issue whereby trust existence is
leaked to unauthorized users (see related bug). Second, it explicitly
prevents the admin user from retrieving a trust. In order to correct the
first issue, we need to change the keystone API to correctly return an
HTTP 403 Forbidden in the case that a trust does not exist. This impacts
tempest, which runs as the admin user, and is expecting to be able to
validate a trust deletion by checking for an HTTP 404 Not Found. We will
be able to correct the bad assumptions about the admin user by updating
the default trust policies to be aware of system scope[1] and default
roles[2]. But in all cases, the list_trusts request works properly for
the admin user and is a reliable indicator of whether a trust exists.

[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818850
[2] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818846

Change-Id: I35d8eac972a8785b629f4cd538b521021fa33353
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/676528
Related-bug: #1840288

be able to correct the bad assumptions about the admin user by updating
the default trust policies to be aware of system scope[1] and default
roles[2]. But in all cases, the list_trusts request works properly for
the admin user and is a reliable indicator of whether a trust exists.

[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818850
[2] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818846

Change-Id: I35d8eac972a8785b629f4cd538b521021fa33353

commit_message:
Use list_trusts to check for deleted trust

The keystone trusts API currently makes some flawed choices about access
control. First, there is a security issue whereby trust existence is
leaked to unauthorized users (see related bug). Second, it explicitly
prevents the admin user from retrieving a trust. In order to correct the
first issue, we need to change the keystone API to correctly return an
HTTP 403 Forbidden in the case that a trust does not exist. This impacts
tempest, which runs as the admin user, and is expecting to be able to
validate a trust deletion by checking for an HTTP 404 Not Found. We will
be able to correct the bad assumptions about the admin user by updating
the default trust policies to be aware of system scope[1] and default
roles[2]. But in all cases, the list_trusts request works properly for
the admin user and is a reliable indicator of whether a trust exists.

[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818850
[2] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818846

Change-Id: I35d8eac972a8785b629f4cd538b521021fa33353
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/676528
Related-bug: #1840288
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/45/676745/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertEmpty(self.trustor_client.list_trusts())

commit_message:
Add py3 jobs with an unspecified minor version

Charm projects maintain compatibility with py35, p36, and are
working to enable future LTS (py37) versions, and would like
to allow devs, users, and CI to call one target (py3).

Use of this target indicates that any Py3 will do, and there is no
expectation of explicitly calling tox tests/builds under a specific
interpreter version.

Change-Id: I65d58e9be4f4a5f506f96e66ff2055d04f155475

subject: Fix systemd service start rate limiting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-15 18:22:53.000000000', 'files': ['paunch/utils/systemctl.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/paunch/commit/5b5e578cc571437965ff55b9c5a660bfe6310b2e', 'message': "Fix systemd service start rate limiting

The default limit is to allow 5 restarts in a 10sec period. If a
service goes over that threshold due to the Restart= config option in
the service definition, it will not attempt to restart any further.

We should not set StartLimitIntervalSec to 0 to disable any kind of
rate limiting as that may end up impacting the node load.

Instead, use tenacity to retry with an exponential backoff, when the
service unit enablement fails. Before to retry it, reset the unit's
failure counters with the systemctl wrapper. This is a crash-loop
approach that provides an efficient feature parity to the classic
rate limiting, shall we want to implement that for the systemctl
command wrapper instead.

Closes-bug: #1839841

Change-Id: I537fbf9933f2cbe6e1c2f627ba77da645bd55f25
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2eaebe2cd96aa1e121d02f6998e5addd7c52ef86)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix systemd service start rate limiting

The default limit is to allow 5 restarts in a 10sec period. If a
service goes over that threshold due to the Restart= config option in
the service definition, it will not attempt to restart any further.

We should not set StartLimitIntervalSec to 0 to disable any kind of
rate limiting as that may end up impacting the node load.

Instead, use tenacity to retry with an exponential backoff, when the
service unit enablement fails. Before to retry it, reset the unit's
failure counters with the systemctl wrapper. This is a crash-loop
approach that provides an efficient feature parity to the classic
rate limiting, shall we want to implement that for the systemctl
command wrapper instead.

Closes-bug: #1839841

Change-Id: I537fbf9933f2cbe6e1c2f627ba77da645bd55f25
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2eaebe2cd96aa1e121d02f6998e5addd7c52ef86)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/paunch refs/changes/49/676749/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import tenacitydef reset_failed(service, log=None): systemctl(['reset-failed', service], log) # NOTE(bogdando): this implements a crash-loop with reset-failed # counters approach that provides an efficient feature parity to the # classic rate limiting, shall we want to implement that for the # systemctl command wrapper instead. @tenacity.retry( # Retry up to 5 times with jittered exponential backoff reraise=True, retry=tenacity.retry_if_exception_type( SystemctlException ), wait=tenacity.wait_random_exponential(multiplier=1, max=10), stop=tenacity.stop_after_attempt(5) ) try: systemctl(cmd, log) except SystemctlException as err: # Reset failure counters for the service unit and retry reset_failed(service, log) raise SystemctlException(str(err))

commit_message:
Strip prefix when paginating

The way the next URL is parsed and rebuilt in the pagination code
doesn't take a prefixed path into account like devstack uses, e.g.
/baremetal/v1/nodes. It ends up prepending the base URL and we get
/baremetal/baremetal/v1/nodes. Drop the extra prefix when building
this URL.

Change-Id: I7e46068521c40f19c1e48eedc69b4ecd862e88fc
Story: 2006216
Task: 35809
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/00/670600/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jroll) # endpoint_trimmed is what is prepended if we only pass a path # to json_request. This might be something like # https://example.com:4443/baremetal # The code below which parses the 'next' URL keeps any path prefix # we're using, so it ends up calling json_request() with e.g. # /baremetal/v1/nodes. When this is appended to endpoint_trimmed, # we end up with a full URL of e.g. # https://example.com:4443/baremetal/baremetal/v1/nodes. # Parse out the prefix from the base endpoint here, so we can strip # it below and make sure we're passing a correct path. endpoint_parts = urlparse.urlparse(self.api.endpoint_trimmed) url_path_prefix = endpoint_parts[2] if url_path_prefix: url_parts[2] = url_parts[2].replace( url_path_prefix, '', 1)

commit_message:
Lock volume boot pattern scenario tests

This commit adds a lock to the test_volume_boot_pattern tests. Running
these at the same time is suspected to put too much pressure on the lvm
backend and causes failures when they're run at the same time especially
on slower hardware. As a temporary stop gap to protect against that this
commit tries adding a lock to prevent the 2 tests running at the same
time.

Change-Id: I052ea70d8e47dff6c26768829beabc556e4560a0

commit_message:
Enable overcommit_memory in test server VMs

Enable memory overcommit in server VMs to fix an allocation error when
using static binaries that have been compiled with a recent golang
toolchain (>= 1.11).

Story: 2006346
Task: 36103

Change-Id: I1e5979b4e49492c9a84f936681214deac556d856

subject: Fix libvirt driver tests to use LibvirtConfigCapsGuest instances
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-05 15:02:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3fb59df5ae2af93650cf8923e577b93d783135e1', 'message': "Fix libvirt driver tests to use LibvirtConfigCapsGuest instances

test_driver.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_cpu_info() and
test_driver.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_get_instance_capabilities() were
incorrectly adding LibvirtConfigGuest fixture objects to the guests
attribute of LibvirtConfigCaps, rather than LibvirtConfigCapsGuest
objects which is what the parse_dom() method of LibvirtConfigCaps
does.  LibvirtConfigCaps is intended to capture all useful information
returned by libvirt's getCapabilities API call, and
LibvirtConfigCapsGuest is intended to capture a small subset of that.
In contrast, LibvirtConfigGuest is intended for holding the entire
configuration of a libvirt guest domain.

So fix this to instead add LibvirtConfigCapsGuest fixtures.

Note that despite this bug, the tests previously passed through
duck-typing because LibvirtConfigCaps does not define __slots__ or any
other mechanism for limiting how attributes can be set on instances.

This is required by another commit in the SEV series in the near
future which will alter the fields within LibvirtConfigCapsGuest.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ic4cbbaf81938fc88980e44c4a17fe388f9c2b92b

commit_message:
Fix libvirt driver tests to use LibvirtConfigCapsGuest instances

test_driver.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_cpu_info() and
test_driver.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_get_instance_capabilities() were
incorrectly adding LibvirtConfigGuest fixture objects to the guests
attribute of LibvirtConfigCaps, rather than LibvirtConfigCapsGuest
objects which is what the parse_dom() method of LibvirtConfigCaps
does.  LibvirtConfigCaps is intended to capture all useful information
returned by libvirt's getCapabilities API call, and
LibvirtConfigCapsGuest is intended to capture a small subset of that.
In contrast, LibvirtConfigGuest is intended for holding the entire
configuration of a libvirt guest domain.

So fix this to instead add LibvirtConfigCapsGuest fixtures.

Note that despite this bug, the tests previously passed through
duck-typing because LibvirtConfigCaps does not define __slots__ or any
other mechanism for limiting how attributes can be set on instances.

This is required by another commit in the SEV series in the near
future which will alter the fields within LibvirtConfigCapsGuest.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ic4cbbaf81938fc88980e44c4a17fe388f9c2b92b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/29/674629/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: guest = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCapsGuest() guest = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCapsGuest() guest = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCapsGuest() guest = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCapsGuest() guest = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCapsGuest()
deleted_lines: guest = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuest() guest = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuest() guest = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuest() guest = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuest() guest = vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuest()

commit_message:
Allow assertXmlEqual() to pass options to matchers.XMLMatches

matchers.XMLMatches supports three options:

  - allow_mixed_nodes
  - skip_empty_text_nodes
  - skip_values

However these are not accessible when using the matcher via
assertXmlEqual().  So extend the latter with an *options
dictionary to allow options to be passed through.

This will be used by another commit in the SEV series in the near
future which needs the allow_mixed_nodes option to be enabled to
compare XML fragments with elements in different orders.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I31c60771891c3a2eb06fbc780ba2d369465498ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/674628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def assertXmlEqual(self, expected, observed, **options): self.assertThat(observed, matchers.XMLMatches(expected, **options))
deleted_lines: def assertXmlEqual(self, expected, observed): self.assertThat(observed, matchers.XMLMatches(expected))

cleanup: reduce configuration vars

ship with no functional changes for users that were not overriding
them.

commit_message:
Install python2-networking-baremetal in neutron-server

This package contain the ML2 plug-in. Baremetal mechanism driver used
to integrate Ironic and Neutron. This is required for routed networks
support in Ironic.

Also required for routed networks support in containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: I12c36754f8da8dfb8d428ad749afca4b294ec4c4
(cherry picked from commit ae07676c674d25eb9ae0031bf2b9ec325ed86bae)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/89/632589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE (jaosorior): neutron-server with TLS everywhere needs httpd and mod_ssl packages. # NOTE (hjensas): python2-networking-baremetal ML2 plug-in for ironic neutron integration. {% set neutron_server_packages_append = ['httpd', 'mod_ssl', 'python2-networking-baremetal'] %}
deleted_lines: # NOTE (jaosorior): neutron-server with TLS everywhere needs these packages. {% set neutron_server_packages_append = ['httpd', 'mod_ssl'] %}

commit_message:
Add file list for promote-openstack-manuals-lang

If we do not run publishlang job in gate, there's nothing to promote -
so, add the same filelist for both gate and promote job so that we only
publish if something has changed.

Change-Id: Ifeb5f4d92c7e13d51bd2a654e1ec3c2e91f536b3

commit_message:
Handle failed nodes when enabling ssh admin

Filter server list by state before selecting by control plane address to
avoid YAQL expression issues.

Closes-Bug: #1749450
Change-Id: I0ae383105bc5d8849a733bfbe5bd61fb3fc24c66
(cherry picked from commit 3933a66c88293efc016444f04fa92b3c7c3b863a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/29/664929/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with-items: server in <% $.ssh_servers %> input: search_opts: ip: <% $.server %> publish: servers: <% task().result._info %> on-success: create_admin with-items: server in <% $.servers.flatten() %>
deleted_lines: on-success: create_admin publish: servers: <% let(root => $) -> task().result._info.where($.addresses.ctlplane.addr.any($ in $root.ssh_servers)) %> with-items: server in <% $.servers %>

commit_message:
Configure Max Delay for purge job about shadow tables in nova

Recently we have a cron job to purge records in nova shadow tables.
This cron job runs on all controller nodes, but as all controllers
have configuration to run the job at the really same time, which
can result in db lock timeout or db spike.

This patch makes sure that we set a default value to Max Delay
parameter for the cron job, to avoid the problem caused by the
collision.

Change-Id: Id372ce98d8ba761ef313bd90a406737250503cab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/46/667246/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NovaCronPurgeShadowTablesMaxDelay: type: string description: > Cron to purge shadow tables - Max Delay default: '3600'

commit_message:
Set notification driver to noop when enable_telemetry=false

Actually, enable_telemetry=false doesn't do anything because
the notification_drivers values are hardcoded to messaging.
This commit changes this behavior by setting notification_drivers
to noop if enable_telemetry is set to false.

Conflicts:
	elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template

Change-Id: I75441352c29b0421358fc0c87f8708355e7fbb2a
Closes-bug: #1838828
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8b6d68d13fab7cf28388d7e48f2b89be2c8932e8)

commit_message:
Switch output to publish-docs/html

Publishing to a top-level directory has a few challenges with some new
infra scripts. Let's keep those simple and change from publish-docs to
publish-docs/html.

this backports and adjust changes:
https://review.opendev.org/676913
https://review.opendev.org/676483
https://review.opendev.org/676482
https://review.opendev.org/676960

fix also git.openstack.org links so that guides build.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676489
Change-Id: I94b7bf915c0fdad0e9e2f5dd81846f45dc99194a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/42/676942/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Move from publish-docs to publish-docs/html # TODO(AJaeger): Remove once openstack-doc-tools is updated mkdir publish-docs-new mv publish-docs publish-docs-new/html mv publish-docs-new publish-docs rmdir publish-docs/html/id publish-docs/html/ja mv publish-docs/draft publish-docs/html/mitaka
deleted_lines: rmdir publish-docs/id publish-docs/ja mv publish-docs/draft publish-docs/mitaka

This change creates a role for  the tripleo heat template content for
"container-image-prepare-baremetal-ansible.j2.yaml". This change will
ensure our task process is tested using molecule and scenario tests
while also streamlining our process.

Test Matrix:
  - default - tests role using all default options
  - build - tests end to end building containers using mock data

This change creates a role for  the tripleo heat template content for
"container-image-prepare-baremetal-ansible.j2.yaml". This change will
ensure our task process is tested using molecule and scenario tests
while also streamlining our process.

Test Matrix:
  - default - tests role using all default options
  - build - tests end to end building containers using mock data

A new playbook for docker vfs setup has been added. This was added to
allow some tests to run docker workloads within a local filesystem.
Without this change, docker workloads would fail because docker is
not able to run an overlayfs job from within an overlayfs
environment. This new playbook will be used within our zuul jobs
whenever the variable `docker_enable_vfs`, is set to "true".

Change-Id: Ic6e26eb95734ccf17e42e649b5e5808e1a096a78
Story: 2005985
Task: 34438

while also streamlining our process.

Test Matrix:
  - default - tests role using all default options
  - build - tests end to end building containers using mock data

A new playbook for docker vfs setup has been added. This was added to
allow some tests to run docker workloads within a local filesystem.
Without this change, docker workloads would fail because docker is
not able to run an overlayfs job from within an overlayfs
environment. This new playbook will be used within our zuul jobs
whenever the variable `docker_enable_vfs`, is set to "true".

commit_message:
Create tripleo container image prepare role

This change creates a role for  the tripleo heat template content for
"container-image-prepare-baremetal-ansible.j2.yaml". This change will
ensure our task process is tested using molecule and scenario tests
while also streamlining our process.

Test Matrix:
  - default - tests role using all default options
  - build - tests end to end building containers using mock data

A new playbook for docker vfs setup has been added. This was added to
allow some tests to run docker workloads within a local filesystem.
Without this change, docker workloads would fail because docker is
not able to run an overlayfs job from within an overlayfs
environment. This new playbook will be used within our zuul jobs
whenever the variable `docker_enable_vfs`, is set to "true".

Change-Id: Ic6e26eb95734ccf17e42e649b5e5808e1a096a78
Story: 2005985
Task: 34438
Task: 34440
Task: 34441
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. {% if item.registry is defined %} FROM {{ item.registry.url }}/{{ item.image }} {% else %} FROM {{ item.image }} {% endif %} RUN if [ $(command -v apt-get) ]; then apt-get update && apt-get install -y python sudo bash ca-certificates && apt-get clean; \ elif [ $(command -v dnf) ]; then dnf makecache && dnf --assumeyes install python sudo python-devel python*-dnf bash {{ item.pkg_extras | default('') }} && dnf clean all; \ elif [ $(command -v yum) ]; then yum makecache fast && yum install -y python sudo yum-plugin-ovl python-setuptools bash {{ item.pkg_extras | default('') }} && sed -i 's/plugins=0/plugins=1/g' /etc/yum.conf && yum clean all; \ elif [ $(command -v zypper) ]; then zypper refresh && zypper install -y python sudo bash python-xml {{ item.pkg_extras | default('') }} && zypper clean -a; \ elif [ $(command -v apk) ]; then apk update && apk add --no-cache python sudo bash ca-certificates {{ item.pkg_extras | default('') }}; \ elif [ $(command -v xbps-install) ]; then xbps-install -Syu && xbps-install -y python sudo bash ca-certificates {{ item.pkg_extras | default('') }} && xbps-remove -O; fi {% for pkg in item.easy_install | default([]) %} # install pip for centos where there is no python-pip rpm in default repos RUN easy_install {{ pkg }} {% endfor %} CMD ["sh", "-c", "while true; do sleep 10000; done"]

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/670441/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | replace configuration item: ``[libvirt] cpu_model`` to ``[libvirt] cpu_models``, which is an ordered list of CPU models the host supports. If ``[libvirt] cpu_mode`` is set to ``custom``, the libvirt driver will select the first CPU model in the ``cpu_model_list`` list that can provide the required feature traits. deprecations: - | The ``[libvirt] cpu_model`` option is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. The ``[libvirt] cpu_models`` option should be used instead.

commit_message:
Distribute direct charm dependencies

Do not rely on system installed Python packages but distribute the
direct charm dependencies as part of the charms wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see juju/charm-helpers#341 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

Change-Id: I2d728072bfca20e612c2d4c9178095a22f83631c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-manila-generic refs/changes/84/655384/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: options: basic: include_system_packages: false

commit_message:
Distribute direct charm dependencies

Do not rely on system installed Python packages but distribute the
direct charm dependencies as part of the charms wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see juju/charm-helpers#341 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

Change-Id: I29304997cdbe3987fb0e55d3ea67b20550653704

commit_message:
Check for rc instead of |succeeded

We went from `ignore_errors: true` to `failed_when: false` to prevent
Ansible printing errors which aren't really errors. When using
`succeeded` filter on a registered variable from such task, we will
always get true, which is not what we want. Check for `.rc == 0`
instead to set the facts as they were intended.

Change-Id: Ib8dea68720fda86cf4fd879cdf194d206968f6fb
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit e26009fa9c57d42a0c82ebc22169e10741005946)

commit_message:
Update cli docs

Initially I only wanted to update from referencing the roles ``Member``
and ``_member`` to ``member`` and ``reader``, as that are the defaults
now created by ``keystone-manage bootstrap``.

During verifying my changes I notices that some CLI output format had
changed, so I updated those too.

Finally drop listing all the IDs for creating a role assignment, as the
CLI can work with names all the way now.

Change-Id: If585a67639332bcb7e53ca4600884222978af9be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/59/676659/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: you can assign users. Projects are also known as *tenants* or | tags | [] | | domain_id | e601210181f54843b51b3edff41d4980 | | is_domain | False | | parent_id | e601210181f54843b51b3edff41d4980 | | tags | [] | | 71ccc37d41c8491c975ae72676db687f | member | | 9fe2ff9ee4384b1894a90878d3e92bab | reader |user-project pair. $ openstack role add --user USER_NAME --project PROJECT_NAME ROLE_NAME For example, assign the ``new-role`` role to the ``demo`` user and ``test-project`` project pair: --project PROJECT_NAME --names +-------------+--------------+-------+--------------+--------+--------+-----------+ | Role | User | Group | Project | Domain | System | Inherited | +-------------+--------------+-------+--------------+--------+--------+-----------+ | new-role | demo@Default | | demo@Default | | | False | | member | demo@Default | | demo@Default | | | False | | anotherrole | demo@Default | | demo@Default | | | False | +-------------+--------------+-------+--------------+--------+--------+-----------+ $ openstack role remove --user USER_NAME --project PROJECT_NAME ROLE_NAME $ openstack role assignment list --user USER_NAME --project PROJECT_NAME --names``member`` role. In this example, if a user was assigned the prior role, which in this case is the ``admin`` role, they would also get the ``member`` $ openstack implied role create admin --implied-role member role. Therefore assigning a user the ``member`` will not grant them thepieces as if they were a single one. For example, you can have a ``member``and then assign either the full-blown ``member`` role to users or any one of | 29c09e68e6f741afa952a837e29c700b | admin | 71ccc37d41c8491c975ae72676db687f | member | $ openstack implied role delete admin --implied-role member prior role, they will no longer have the roles that it implied.
deleted_lines: you can assign users. Projects are also known as *projects* or | properties | | | 71ccc37d41c8491c975ae72676db687f | Member | | 9fe2ff9ee4384b1894a90878d3e92bab | _member_ |user-project pair. To do this, you need the user, role, and project IDs. #. List users and note the user ID you want to assign to the role: .. code-block:: console $ openstack user list +----------------------------------+----------+ | ID | Name | +----------------------------------+----------+ | 6ab5800949644c3e8fb86aaeab8275c8 | admin | | dfc484b9094f4390b9c51aba49a6df34 | demo | | 55389ff02f5e40cf85a053cc1cacb20c | alt_demo | | bc52bcfd882f4d388485451c4a29f8e0 | nova | | 255388ffa6e54ec991f584cb03085e77 | glance | | 48b6e6dec364428da89ba67b654fac03 | cinder | | c094dd5a8e1d4010832c249d39541316 | neutron | | 6322872d9c7e445dbbb49c1f9ca28adc | new-user | +----------------------------------+----------+ #. List role IDs and note the role ID you want to assign: .. code-block:: console $ openstack role list +----------------------------------+---------------+ | ID | Name | +----------------------------------+---------------+ | 71ccc37d41c8491c975ae72676db687f | Member | | 149f50a1fe684bfa88dae76a48d26ef7 | ResellerAdmin | | 9fe2ff9ee4384b1894a90878d3e92bab | _member_ | | 6ecf391421604da985db2f141e46a7c8 | admin | | deb4fffd123c4d02a907c2c74559dccf | anotherrole | | bef1f95537914b1295da6aa038ef4de6 | new-role | +----------------------------------+---------------+ #. List projects and note the project ID you want to assign to the role: .. code-block:: console $ openstack project list +----------------------------------+--------------------+ | ID | Name | +----------------------------------+--------------------+ | 0b0b995694234521bf93c792ed44247f | new-project | | 29c09e68e6f741afa952a837e29c700b | admin | | 3a7ab11d3be74d3c9df3ede538840966 | invisible_to_admin | | 71a2c23bab884c609774c2db6fcee3d0 | service | | 87e48a8394e34d13afc2646bc85a0d8c | alt_demo | | fef7ae86615f4bf5a37c1196d09bcb95 | demo | +----------------------------------+--------------------+ $ openstack role add --user USER_NAME --project TENANT_ID ROLE_NAME For example, assign the ``new-role`` role to the ``demo`` and ``test-project`` pair: --project PROJECT_ID --names +----------------------------------+-------------+---------+------+ | ID | Name | Project | User | +----------------------------------+-------------+---------+------+ | a34425c884c74c8881496dc2c2e84ffc | new-role | demo | demo | | 04a7e3192c0745a2b1e3d2baf5a3ee0f | Member | demo | demo | | 62bcf3e27eef4f648eb72d1f9920f6e5 | anotherrole | demo | demo | +----------------------------------+-------------+---------+------+ $ openstack role remove --user USER_NAME --project TENANT_ID ROLE_NAME $ openstack role assignment list --user USER_NAME --project TENANT_ID --names``Member`` role. In this example, if a user was assigned the prior role, which in this case is the ``admin`` role, they would also get the ``Member`` $ openstack implied role create admin --implied-role Member role. Therefore assigning a user the ``Member`` will not grant them thepieces as if they were a single one. For example, you can have a ``Member``and then assign either the full-blown ``Member`` role to users or any one of | 29c09e68e6f741afa952a837e29c700b | admin | 71ccc37d41c8491c975ae72676db687f | Member | $ openstack implied role delete admin --implied-role Member prior role, they will no longer have the roles that it implied.

commit_message:
Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: I161a3983e23b0ae50c232eb63ca78f8fd230e91e

commit_message:
Cleanup jobs

Follow job rename  in openstack-manuals, remove now unused
checkbuild environment and simplify build-index.sh script
since the same content is build everytime.

Also remove www/www-index.html, we do not use it anymore.

commit_message:
Allow cinder coordination backend to be configured

This is to allow operator to prevent enabling redis and/or
etcd from magically configuring cinder coordinator.

Note this change is backwards-compatible.

Change-Id: Ie10be55968e43e3b9cc347b1b58771c1f7b1b910
Related-Bug: #1840070
Signed-off-by: Radosaw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

commit_message:
tftp: start on boot & fix tftp paths

This fixes the tftp service name on CentOS and makes sure that
the service is running on boot.  It also makes sure that the
tftp_root is setup correctly for the default configuration
on CentOS.

Change-Id: I56944ea905b5ea908cf1e93d5ae1325e68788562

commit_message:
Revert "Remove explict enum-compat"

This reverts commit acfd446c03324e9fb22b2598629d79d8c0bc026a.
The workarounds discussed here are implemented in ocata/pike,
Stein and above doesn't need enum-compat. However Rocky
would still fail without this.

Change-Id: I83fe0c46cad24d9a1c64c4047429bb3491791fe5

revisions:

commit_message:
Add 'path' query parameter to console access url

Starting in noVNC v1.1.0, the token query parameter is no longer
forwarded via cookie [1]. We must instead use the 'path' query
parameter to pass the token through to the websocketproxy [2].
This means that if someone deploys noVNC v1.1.0, VNC consoles will
break in nova because the code is relying on the cookie functionality
that v1.1.0 removed.

This modifies the ConsoleAuthToken.access_url property to include the
'path' query parameter as part of the returned access_url that the
client will use to call the console proxy service.

This change is backward compatible with noVNC < v1.1.0. The 'path' query
parameter is a long supported feature in noVNC.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1822676

 Conflicts:
	doc/source/admin/remote-console-access.rst
	nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are due to the following changes not being
in Rocky:

added_lines: tox -evenv -- sphinx-build -q -E -W -b gettext \ # Build book BUILD_DIR="${DOC_DIR}${book}/build/html" DOCTREES="${BUILD_DIR}.doctrees" tox -evenv -- sphinx-build \ -q -E -D language=${language} \ -d ${DOCTREES} \ ${DOC_DIR}${book}/source/ \ ${BUILD_DIR} PUBLISH_DIR=publish-docs/html/${language}/${book}/ mkdir -p ${PUBLISH_DIR} rsync -a ${DOC_DIR}${book}/build/html/ ${PUBLISH_DIR} echo $MARKER_TEXT > ${PUBLISH_DIR}/.root-marker echo "PURPOSE is 'test' or 'publish' (is ignored)."
deleted_lines: FIRSTAPP_TAGS="libcloud dotnet fog openstacksdk pkgcloud shade" TAG="" # We need to extract all strings, so add all supported tags if [ ${book} = "firstapp" ] ; then TAG="-t libcloud -t fog -t dotnet -t openstacksdk -t pkgcloud -t shade" fi tox -evenv -- sphinx-build -q -E -W -b gettext $TAG \ # Build all books if [ ${book} = "firstapp" ] ; then # Firstapp has several variations, build all of them for tag in $FIRSTAPP_TAGS ; do BUILD_DIR="${DOC_DIR}${book}/build-${tag}/html" DOCTREES="${BUILD_DIR}.doctrees" tox -evenv -- sphinx-build -q -E \ -t $tag -D language=${language} \ -d ${DOCTREES} \ ${DOC_DIR}${book}/source/ \ ${BUILD_DIR} PUBLISH_DIR=publish-docs/html/${language}/${book}-${tag} mkdir -p ${PUBLISH_DIR} rsync -a ${DOC_DIR}${book}/build-${tag}/html/ ${PUBLISH_DIR} echo $MARKER_TEXT > ${PUBLISH_DIR}/.root-marker done else BUILD_DIR="${DOC_DIR}${book}/build/html" DOCTREES="${BUILD_DIR}.doctrees" tox -evenv -- sphinx-build \ -q -E -D language=${language} \ -d ${DOCTREES} \ ${DOC_DIR}${book}/source/ \ ${BUILD_DIR} PUBLISH_DIR=publish-docs/html/${language}/${book}/ mkdir -p ${PUBLISH_DIR} rsync -a ${DOC_DIR}${book}/build/html/ ${PUBLISH_DIR} echo $MARKER_TEXT > ${PUBLISH_DIR}/.root-marker fi args=("-v") if [[ $PURPOSE -eq "publish" ]]; then args+=("--publish") fi args+=("--check-build" "-l $language") echo "PURPOSE is either 'test' or 'publish'."

commit_message:
Add prometheus_client to monasca-agent image

The prometheus_client package is required to use the Prometheus plugin.
It makes sense to include this dependency by default since Kolla Ansible
can deploy many Prometheus exporters, making it easy to scrape their
metrics and store them in Monasca. The increase in size of the container
image is negligible.

Change-Id: I9b0a162513ed436930c4541b758fc9cb2ef97e96
(cherry picked from commit a74aa1bd21b04eceede6cf425a5e56dcacec1412)

commit_message:
Cleanup jobs and config

Use promote jobs for all publishing jobs, they work fine.

We don't use checkbuild/checklang anymore, remove it.

Keep checkbuild job until we have renamed training-guides to use the new
job.

Change-Id: I882fd90f07987358cd55e3a04a8f7ad0c746ce80

commit_message:
Document minor update of DCN deployment

Add high level steps of how to use the minor update procedure with a DCN
deployment.

Change-Id: I61cbcaefd78fc51103c205551fcbab6ac0a0676d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/58/672758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Deploying DCN ------------- Updating DCN ------------ Each stack in a multi-stack DCN deployment must be updated to perform a full minor update across the entire deployment. The minor update procedure as detailed in :ref:`package_update` be run for each stack in the deployment. The control-plane or central stack should be updated first by completing all the steps from the minor update procedure. Once the central stack is updated, re-run the export commands from :ref:`export_dcn` to recreate the required input files for each separate DCN stack. .. note:: When re-running the export commands, save the generated files in a new directory so that the previous versions are not overwritten. In the event that a separate DCN stack needs a stack update operation performed prior to the minor update procedure, the previous versions of the exported files should be used. Each separate DCN stack can then be updated individually as required. There is no requirement as to the order of which DCN stack is updated first.

commit_message:
Mark Storpool Driver Unsupported

The Storpool Driver 3rd Party CI hasn't
reported in over 60 days.  This does not meet the requirements
for Cinder's 3rd Party CI requirements.

As a result the driver is being marked unsupported in the
Train release and should be removed in the 'U' release if
the problems are not resolved.

Change-Id: Ia385485d41617e1be5c6b60705ee39e39832a945
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/42/674642/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | The Storpool driver has been marked as unsupported and is now deprecated. ``enable_unsupported_driver`` will need to be set to ``True`` in the driver's section in cinder.conf to continue to use it. deprecations: - | The Storpool driver has been marked as unsupported and is now deprecated. ``enable_unsupported_driver`` will need to be set to ``True`` in the driver's section in cinder.conf to continue to use it. If its support status does not change, it will be removed in the 'U' development cycle.

commit_message:
Distribute direct charm dependencies

Do not rely on system installed Python packages but distribute the
direct charm dependencies as part of the charms wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see juju/charm-helpers#341 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

Change-Id: Ie868ed20563d3e37e19ba513ccffe575923bb9e4

commit_message:
Fix non-existent method of Mock

There is no method called_once_with() in Mock object.
Use assert_called_once_with() or assert_has_calls() instead.

Change-Id: I9f73fcbe7c3dfd64e75ac8224c13934b03443cd5
Closes-Bug: #1544522

subject: add patch to make cinder-tempest-tests pass again
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-15 12:16:27.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/cinder-tempest-plugin.spec.j2', 'openstack/cinder-tempest-plugin/0001-Fix-volume-revert-to-snapshot-tests.patch'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging/commit/856e0fc4fc69dbac511db2e1db05169e9e61696e', 'message': 'add patch to make cinder-tempest-tests pass again

The behavior was changed in https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798503
which got backported to rocky, causing the tempest test to fail.

We either need to update to 0.2.0 (which is not listed as compatible
with rocky) or add the backport of the behavior change.

Change-Id: I2fab50ad9590ec0d982b61c0d6180d0dbfc085cb

commit_message:
add patch to make cinder-tempest-tests pass again

The behavior was changed in https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798503
which got backported to rocky, causing the tempest test to fail.

We either need to update to 0.2.0 (which is not listed as compatible
with rocky) or add the backport of the behavior change.

Change-Id: I2fab50ad9590ec0d982b61c0d6180d0dbfc085cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/83/676683/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: From f208601ab5ba7e33cff535595d4ce480489ef4b9 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001 From: "Erlon R. Cruz" <erlon@netapp.com> Date: Mon, 5 Nov 2018 17:44:21 -0200 Subject: [PATCH] Fix volume revert to snapshot tests According to the revert to snapshot spec, it should not be possible to revert a volume to a snapshot after the volume is extended. This was fixed on [1] but the cinder_tempest_plugin test still was being considering the old behavior. [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798503 Change-Id: I21d0b2291608922e46278ae5799478a5df0c4904 --- .../api/volume/test_volume_revert.py | 19 +++++++------------ 1 file changed, 7 insertions(+), 12 deletions(-) diff --git a/cinder_tempest_plugin/api/volume/test_volume_revert.py b/cinder_tempest_plugin/api/volume/test_volume_revert.py index f7e91699..8a2f657c 100644 --- a/cinder_tempest_plugin/api/volume/test_volume_revert.py +++ b/cinder_tempest_plugin/api/volume/test_volume_revert.py @@ -16,6 +16,7 @@ from tempest.common import waiters from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators +from tempest.lib import exceptions from cinder_tempest_plugin.api.volume import base from cinder_tempest_plugin import cinder_clients @@ -65,7 +66,7 @@ class VolumeRevertTests(base.BaseVolumeTest): self.assertEqual(expected_size, volume['size']) @decorators.idempotent_id('4e8b0788-87fe-430d-be7a-444d7f8e0347') - def test_volume_revert_to_snapshot_after_extended(self): + def test_volume_revert_to_snapshot_after_extended_negative(self): """Test revert to snapshot after extended""" # Extend volume to double the size expected_size = self.volume['size'] * 2 @@ -74,14 +75,8 @@ class VolumeRevertTests(base.BaseVolumeTest): new_size=expected_size) waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status(self.volumes_client, self.volume['id'], 'available') - # Revert to snapshot - self.volume_revert_client.revert_to_snapshot(self.volume, - self.snapshot['id']) - waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status( - self.volumes_client, - self.volume['id'], 'available') - waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status( - self.snapshots_client, - self.snapshot['id'], 'available') - volume = self.volumes_client.show_volume(self.volume['id'])['volume'] - self.assertEqual(expected_size, volume['size']) + + # Destination volume smaller than source, API should block that + self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, + self.volume_revert_client.revert_to_snapshot, + self.volume, self.snapshot) -- 2.22.0

commit_message:
CI: drop docker systemd MountFlags

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674587/ dropped using of that flag in
deployments. Time to drop it on CI as Debian CI fails when it is
enabled.

Change-Id: I57fa5206f91abcedcd2d526e71e74cf634b81d2c

commit_message:
Fix checking mongodb replication status

backport: stein, rocky

The reason it did not work before was that the other handlers had never been called
after [0], tasks from start.yml were move to handler which cannot act
like tasks, also bootstrap tasks must run after 'Restart mongodb container'.

This commit adds a notify after 'Restart mongodb container' for triger
task 'bootstrap_cluster.yml'.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/40b635b9c538e3d971f6e40db4fb3900135117e6

Change-Id: I4e2fbe9a8f20afcc4e25a01e23e5231e74eeeec4
(cherry picked from commit 6bb01bd7b1a6a8e50469ba6e606fb3689ae2f60d)

commit_message:
[gnocchi] Don't recursively modify file perms on start

For deployments with a lot of Gnocchi data, this is a non-starter
(literally... the service basically can't start.) There maybe needs to
be a way to configure this, or only do it during deploy/bootstrap?
Unclear, but disabling for now; users can `chown -R gnocchi:gnocchi`
themselves in the meantime if need be.

Change-Id: I0bae6dfbbee9f63506c89bd6b392e7be07fd5930
(cherry picked from commit 464fefb1ef0daddd33a08f1645a5bbb8e24b98df)

commit_message:
Enable iscsid on cinder-backup hosts

Without this we may see the following error in cinder-backup when using
the LVM backend:

    Could not login to any iSCSI portal

Enabling the iscsid container on hosts in the cinder-backup group fixes
this.

Closes-Bug: #1838624

Change-Id: If373c002b0744ce9dbdffed50a02bab55dd0acb9
Co-Authored-By: dmitry-a-grachev <dmitry.a.grachev@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ec075240541996f812ba39bdb84f21ddfa01d77f)

commit_message:
Fix the redis_connection_string for osprofiler and make it generic

* When using redis as the backend of osprofiler, it cannot connect to
redis because the redis_connection_string is incorrect.

* Let other places that use redis also use this variable.

Change-Id: I14de6597932d05cd7f804a35c6764ba4ae9087cd
Closes-Bug: #1833200
Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit cd836dd39f00c9a265571fc2745d9642ca72cd77)

commit_message:
[gnocchi] Don't recursively modify file perms on start

For deployments with a lot of Gnocchi data, this is a non-starter
(literally... the service basically can't start.) There maybe needs to
be a way to configure this, or only do it during deploy/bootstrap?
Unclear, but disabling for now; users can `chown -R gnocchi:gnocchi`
themselves in the meantime if need be.

Change-Id: I0bae6dfbbee9f63506c89bd6b392e7be07fd5930
(cherry picked from commit 464fefb1ef0daddd33a08f1645a5bbb8e24b98df)

commit_message:
Fix checking mongodb replication status

backport: stein, rocky

The reason it did not work before was that the other handlers had never been called
after [0], tasks from start.yml were move to handler which cannot act
like tasks, also bootstrap tasks must run after 'Restart mongodb container'.

This commit adds a notify after 'Restart mongodb container' for triger
task 'bootstrap_cluster.yml'.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/40b635b9c538e3d971f6e40db4fb3900135117e6

Change-Id: I4e2fbe9a8f20afcc4e25a01e23e5231e74eeeec4
(cherry picked from commit 6bb01bd7b1a6a8e50469ba6e606fb3689ae2f60d)

commit_message:
Remove unused helpers in ovs_lib

1. count_flows is created in 1121807b8528590b20e1109dbdff400fccec3c38
   and never used.
2. get_ingress_bw_limit_for_dpdk_port is created in 1be857435288e4008a41fe67bbc8795dd3d8b134
   and never used.
3. get_local_port_mac is no longer used after bdfe8dcf42275f22afa457fccf188d2e3352e4a7
4. use_at_least_protocol is no longer used after cf37563c8393f964e7f390f13c43070791360cc1
5. remove_all_flows is no longer used after fcde09462da78fdc6e2fc886a164abf6fb60fefe

This is to remove them for code clean.

Change-Id: I17740053c29a1629d574a07aadb38a1522445dd9

commit_message:
Upgrade base docker image to Bionic(18.04)

This patch upgrades base docker image from Xenial(16.04)
to Bionic(18.04), so that we can use the lastest LTS for
both host and docker container images.

Change-Id: I88191a00316ecae1ce3a6ff530fc7447cf27784e

commit_message:
osc-placement 1.6.0

This library was not released since March. Libraries should be
regularly released to make their new features available to consumers.

This change was generated semi-automatically. If there is a good reason
to hold on releasing this (like if you are waiting for a specific
feature or bugfix to land before releasing), please -1 this.

Change-Id: I0ee032f305c2f8969077f995bcff4e1610346448

commit_message:
py3: port dlo func tests

Drive-by: fix an issue where tf.config wasn't initialized when we decide
whether to skip test_dlo_referer_on_segment_container.

Change-Id: Iad8b3ab40dccb23847cde5c09f55627da0963fe0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/20/642920/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from swift.common.swob import Request, Response, wsgi_quote, wsgi_unquote, \ HTTPRequestedRangeNotSatisfiable, HTTPBadRequest, HTTPConflict, \ bytes_to_wsgi RateLimitedIterator, close_if_possible, closing_if_possible def _get_container_listing(self, req, version, wsgi_account, wsgi_container, wsgi_prefix, wsgi_marker=''): path=wsgi_quote('/'.join(['', version, wsgi_account, wsgi_container])), con_req.query_string = 'prefix=%s' % wsgi_quote(wsgi_prefix) if wsgi_marker: con_req.query_string += '&marker=%s' % wsgi_quote(wsgi_marker) con_resp.body = b'' return None, json.loads(b''.join(con_resp.app_iter)) def _segment_listing_iterator(self, req, version, wsgi_account, wsgi_container, wsgi_prefix, segments, first_byte=None, wsgi_seg_name = bytes_to_wsgi(segment['name'].encode("utf-8")) _path = "/".join(["", version, wsgi_account, wsgi_container, wsgi_seg_name]) wsgi_marker = bytes_to_wsgi(segments[-1]['name'].encode('utf8')) req, version, wsgi_account, wsgi_container, wsgi_prefix, wsgi_marker) (error_response.status_int, wsgi_account, wsgi_container)) container = wsgi_unquote(container) obj_prefix = wsgi_unquote(obj_prefix) etag.update(seg_dict['hash'].strip('"').encode('utf-8'))
deleted_lines: from six.moves.urllib.parse import unquotefrom swift.common.swob import Request, Response, \ HTTPRequestedRangeNotSatisfiable, HTTPBadRequest, HTTPConflict RateLimitedIterator, quote, close_if_possible, closing_if_possible def _get_container_listing(self, req, version, account, container, prefix, marker=''): path=quote('/'.join(['', version, account, container])), con_req.query_string = 'prefix=%s' % quote(prefix) if marker: con_req.query_string += '&marker=%s' % quote(marker) con_resp.body = '' return None, json.loads(''.join(con_resp.app_iter)) def _segment_listing_iterator(self, req, version, account, container, prefix, segments, first_byte=None, seg_name = segment['name'] if isinstance(seg_name, six.text_type): seg_name = seg_name.encode("utf-8") _path = "/".join(["", version, account, container, seg_name]) marker = segments[-1]['name'] req, version, account, container, prefix, marker) (error_response.status_int, account, container)) container = unquote(container) obj_prefix = unquote(obj_prefix) etag.update(seg_dict['hash'].strip('"'))

subject: Avoid duplicate ProviderSummary in _merge_candidates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-09 12:15:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/commit/14f39a3e91f50b8dd298eae4f2617cade91f2c78', 'message': "WIP: Avoid duplicate ProviderSummary in _merge_candidates

In testing with the nested-perfload topology, containing 7000
providers, _merge_candidates was returning 21000 ProviderSummary
objects which were not trimmed until serialization processing in
handlers/allocation_candidate.py.

As we now have rw_ctx.summaries_by_id, instead of pasing around
a bunch of summary objects redundantly, we can instead pass around
ids used to access that data structure.

_alloc_candidates_multiple_providers and
_alloc_candidates_single_provider now returns keys of
rw_ctx.summaries_by_id instead of values. In neither of those methods is
a list required in either return value, so the case to list is removed.

In _merge_candidates all_psums is changed from a list to set,
removing duplicate ids on add(). At the end of the method, the
summaries which are in tree_ids are pulled from the summaries_by_id
holding area.

HOWEVER: See the FIXME added within. We're setting candidates with
too much information.

Change-Id: Ibccaed40f1eac9c244cf70654f6be1d72f7a6054
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-08-09 15:31:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/commit/8547a8c08882f750eb150303c8417bf524115299', 'message': "Avoid duplicate ProviderSummary in _merge_candidates

In testing with the nested-perfload topology, containing 7000
providers, _merge_candidates was returning 21000 ProviderSummary
objects which were not trimmed until serialization processing in
handlers/allocation_candidate.py. That situation has been present
at least since when we added same_subtree [1] so is not simply
because of the addition of rw_ctx.summaries_by_id [2]

Teasing out fixing this exposed a lot of opporutnities for
shrinking the amount of data being inspected and processed.

In no particular order the changes are:

* Return set() from _alloc_candidates_single_provider and
  _alloc_candidates_multiple_providers instead of list. It doesn't need
  to be a list and the cast to list costs.

* Because we have rw_ctx.summaries_by_id we don't need to return
  summaries from _get_by_one_request, they're in the rw_ctx.

* The candidates provided to _merge_candidates is no longer a dict of
  tuples of allocatation requests and summaries (_all_ the summaries).
  It's just a dict of allocation requests.

* _merge_candidates is updated to deal with this new structure of
  input. In the process information is looked up somewhat differently:
  we don't have summaries, but we do have the resoure providers and
  resource classes in the allocation request and the associated
  request resources

* At the end of _merge_candidates we need to winnow the contents of
  rw_ctx.summaries_by_id to only those that still matter.

* In the process of making these fixes a bug was revealed in
  _get_ancestors_by_one_uuid that wasn't noticed before because the
  parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid dict was more populated than it is now

[1] I7fdeac24606359d37f1a7405d22c5797840e1a9e
[2] I43ae1118421366336b4e96738c2981e07caebec8
Change-Id: Ibccaed40f1eac9c244cf70654f6be1d72f7a6054
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2019-08-12 16:28:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/commit/24acc4bc6a3d3526c741fdb52ecfd826ae134326', 'message': "Avoid duplicate ProviderSummary in _merge_candidates

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2019-08-13 14:36:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/placement/commit/5c994907d7f93469f71ffb0b6edb62f8362a172b', 'message': "WIP: Avoid duplicate ProviderSummary in _merge_candidates

In testing with the nested-perfload topology, containing 7000
providers, _merge_candidates was returning 21000 ProviderSummary
objects which were not trimmed until serialization processing in
handlers/allocation_candidate.py. That situation has been present
at least since when we added same_subtree [1] so is not simply
because of the addition of rw_ctx.summaries_by_id [2]

Teasing out fixing this exposed a lot of opporutnities for
shrinking the amount of data being inspected and processed.

In no particular order the changes are:

* Return set() from _alloc_candidates_single_provider and
  _alloc_candidates_multiple_providers instead of list. It doesn't need
  to be a list and the cast to list costs.

* Because we have rw_ctx.summaries_by_id we don't need to return
  summaries from _get_by_one_request, they're in the rw_ctx.

* The candidates provided to _merge_candidates is no longer a dict of
  tuples of allocatation requests and summaries (_all_ the summaries).
  It's just a dict of allocation requests.

* _merge_candidates is updated to deal with this new structure of
  input. In the process information is looked up somewhat differently:
  we don't have summaries, but we do have the resoure providers and
  resource classes in the allocation request and the associated
  request resources

* At the end of _merge_candidates we need to winnow the contents of
  rw_ctx.summaries_by_id to only those that still matter.

* An rw_ctx.parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid is managed and updated in
  _build_provider_summaries instead of having something local to
  _merge_candidates. This helps to avoid any doubt about whether
  or not all relevant providers have their parents recorded.

This is a WIP because it is too much lumped in one place.

[2] I43ae1118421366336b4e96738c2981e07caebec8

  rw_ctx.summaries_by_id to only those that still matter.

commit_message:
Avoid duplicate ProviderSummary in _merge_candidates

In testing with the nested-perfload topology containing 7000
providers, _merge_candidates had been returning 21000 ProviderSummary
objects which were not trimmed until serialization processing in
handlers/allocation_candidate.py. That situation has been present
at least since when we added same_subtree [1] so is not simply
because of the addition of rw_ctx.summaries_by_id [2].

Teasing out fixing this exposed a lot of opportunities for
shrinking the amount of data being inspected and processed.

In no particular order the changes are:

* Return set() from _alloc_candidates_single_provider and
  _alloc_candidates_multiple_providers instead of list. It doesn't need
  to be a list and the cast to list costs.

* Because we have rw_ctx.summaries_by_id we don't need to return
  summaries from _get_by_one_request, they're in the rw_ctx.

* The candidates provided to _merge_candidates is no longer a dict of
  tuples of allocatation requests and summaries (_all_ the summaries).
  It's just a dict of allocation requests.

* At the end of _merge_candidates we need to winnow the contents of
  rw_ctx.summaries_by_id to only those that still matter.

[1] I7fdeac24606359d37f1a7405d22c5797840e1a9e
[2] I43ae1118421366336b4e96738c2981e07caebec8
Change-Id: Ibccaed40f1eac9c244cf70654f6be1d72f7a6054
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/placement refs/changes/06/675606/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: alloc_reqs, summary_ids = cls._get_by_one_request(rg_ctx, rw_ctx) candidates[suffix] = alloc_reqs, summary_ids return set(), set() # FIXME(cdent): Whether this is values() or keys() this is all of the # summaries we know about, which means, later, candidates is doing too # much work with too much data in _merge_candidates. return alloc_requests, rw_ctx.summaries_by_id.keys() return set(), set() # FIXME(cdent): Whether this is values() or keys() this is all of the # summaries we know about, which means, later, candidates is doing too # much work with too much data in _merge_candidates. return alloc_requests, rw_ctx.summaries_by_id.keys() (allocation_requests, provider_summary_ids), produce a single tuple of (allocation_requests, provider_summary_ids) to be merged. # Save off all the provider summary ids - we'll use 'em later. all_psums = set() for suffix, (areqs, psum_ids) in candidates.items(): for rp_id in psum_ids: all_psums.add(rp_id) summary = rw_ctx.summaries_by_id[rp_id] parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid[summary.resource_provider.uuid] = ( summary.resource_provider.parent_provider_uuid) for psum_res in summary.resources: summary.resource_provider, psum_res.resource_class) psums = [rw_ctx.summaries_by_id[psum] for psum in all_psums if rw_ctx.summaries_by_id[psum].resource_provider.root_provider_uuid in tree_uuids]
deleted_lines: alloc_reqs, summaries = cls._get_by_one_request(rg_ctx, rw_ctx) candidates[suffix] = alloc_reqs, summaries return [], [] return list(alloc_requests), list(rw_ctx.summaries_by_id.values()) return [], [] return alloc_requests, list(rw_ctx.summaries_by_id.values()) (allocation_requests, provider_summaries), produce a single tuple of (allocation_requests, provider_summaries) to be merged. # Save off all the provider summaries lists - we'll use 'em later. all_psums = [] for suffix, (areqs, psums) in candidates.items(): for psum in psums: all_psums.append(psum) parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid[psum.resource_provider.uuid] = ( psum.resource_provider.parent_provider_uuid) for psum_res in psum.resources: psum.resource_provider, psum_res.resource_class) psums = [psum for psum in all_psums if psum.resource_provider.root_provider_uuid in tree_uuids]

subject: Handle more return codes from nova-status upgrade check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-15 08:15:33.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/nova/tasks/upgrade.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/dcd726a57d9602991ea166f24651e528f1677ac9', 'message': 'Handle more return codes from nova-status upgrade check

In a single controller scenario, the "Upgrade status check result"
does nothing because the previous task can only succeed when
`nova-status upgrade check` returns code 0. This change allows this
command to fail, so that the value of returned code stored in
`nova_upgrade_check_stdout` can then be analysed.

This change also allows for warnings (rc 1) to pass.
Closes-Bug: 1834647

Change-Id: I6f5e37832f43f23604920b9d890cc505ca924ff9
(cherry picked from commit c68ed4dd516e37844a3eb9cdd2089c985173571d)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle more return codes from nova-status upgrade check

In a single controller scenario, the "Upgrade status check result"
does nothing because the previous task can only succeed when
`nova-status upgrade check` returns code 0. This change allows this
command to fail, so that the value of returned code stored in
`nova_upgrade_check_stdout` can then be analysed.

This change also allows for warnings (rc 1) to pass.
Closes-Bug: 1834647

Change-Id: I6f5e37832f43f23604920b9d890cc505ca924ff9
(cherry picked from commit c68ed4dd516e37844a3eb9cdd2089c985173571d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/29/676629/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: failed_when: false - "There was an upgrade status check failure!" when: hostvars[first_nova_api_host]['nova_upgrade_check_stdout']['rc'] not in [0, 1]
deleted_lines: - "There was an upgrade status check warning or failure!" when: hostvars[first_nova_api_host]['nova_upgrade_check_stdout']['rc'] != 0

commit_message:

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/36/676936/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenDev `OpenDev <https://opendev.org>`__ is a space for collaborative Open Source software development. OpenDevs mission is to provide project hosting, continuous integration tooling, and virtual collaboration spaces for Open Source software projects. OpenDev is itself self hosted on this set of tools including code review, continuous integration, etherpad, wiki, code browsing and so on. This means that OpenDev itself is run like an open source project, you can join us and help run the system. Additionally, all of the services run are Open Source software themselves. The OpenStack project is the largest project using OpenDev. `Zuul <https://zuul-ci.org>`__ is an open source CI/CD platform specializing in gating changes across multiple systems and applications before landing a single patch. Zuul is used for OpenStack development to ensure that only tested code gets merged.
deleted_lines: Tool used in OpenStack development to ensure correctly ordered testing of changes in parallel.
